messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] +Re: parents wanting to be treated as children
messages.msgSnippet: -=-Is this actually possible? To get something to be un-cool? -=- It happens when you don t want it to happen, in my experience. :-) -=-Also, I missed the
messages.messageBody:
-=-Is this actually possible? To get something to be un-cool? -=-

It happens when you don't want it to happen, in my experience. :-)

-=-Also, I missed the original discussion on Facebook, could someone post a link?-=-

http://www.facebook.com/groups/unschooling

It's down in here, but it's a shame for people to invest time in facebook discussions, as they disappear in the flood of blah blah blah.

Sandra



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: +Re: parents wanting to be treated as children
messages.msgSnippet: **(I just wish so many alternative moms didn t think unschooling was cool - can we somehow get it to be un-cool? That would save a lot of time and energy.)**
messages.messageBody:
**(I just wish so many "alternative" moms didn't think unschooling was cool - can we somehow get it to be un-cool? That would save a lot of time and energy.)**

Is this actually possible? To get something to be un-cool? And to add on to that thought, I wish people would stop thinking that it is easy!

I like how someone defended the incoherency of the said parent. Often times as I am working through an issue I waffle like a sheet hangin' on the line. I am absolutely certain that there have been ( and will be) times that I make absolutely no sense.

Also, I missed the original discussion on Facebook, could someone post a link?



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
